text: my name is Mark Rollins
I'm head of cross and Mia public sector
solution architecture for Amazon web
services and I join Amazon web services
in 2012 so I'm here 10 years I joined
the Dublin team I was the 11th
developer support engineer back then we
had 20 Services right now we've got over
200 Services I moved in 2014 to the
public sector I really wanted to see
what kind of an impact they could have
on the lives of citizens through you
know Cloud technology we have customers
in public sector from central government
to local government education and health
and also some of our bigger
International customers who are part of
our intergovernmental organizations team
I recently joined people with
disabilities affinity group here in
Dublin and I'm an advocate for
neurodiversity in the workplace it's
super important to build diverse teams
it really helps us connect with our
customers if I look at our customers now
there's more diversity in the workplace
than there ever has been before so
having having been able to meet
customers in the same level it's a
really fulfilling experience and it
leads to really good conversations for
customers
flexibility is key key in my role for a
number of different reasons flexibility
to be able to meet and work with
customers in different time zones I live
in the west coast of Ireland and I lead
teams you know right across Emir so time
zones are always challenging and I also
work odd hours having that flexibility
really allows me to find a balance
between my personal life and my working
life as well
I'm a big fan of the outdoors I really
love being close to the ocean lots of
water sports I love to surf in fact
that's why I moved to the West Coast of
Ireland to be have the proximity and
it's not like other sports where you can
just show up and you know to a squash
court and put you know a fiver in and
turn on the lights uh it only you know
you can only do this at certain times of
the day or specific so I suppose it's
getting back to the flexibility having

yeah it's awesome
